column1: Steve wakes up at 5 AM every day to train for his first marathon.
She spends weekends building her artwork portfolio, hoping to get into a top art school.
John watches TV for hours, avoiding any conversation about future plans.
Maria always hands over her assignments a week in advance.
They spent years perfecting their craft to open a Michelin-star restaurant.
I dream of owning my own tech startup someday.
You rarely see her participating in any extracurricular activities.
Jacob stayed late at the office to finish the project before the deadline.
The kids in the neighborhood dream of becoming astronauts, firefighters, and more.
Sarah doesn't seem to care about advancing in her career.
Every day after school, Tim practices the violin for several hours.
The team set a goal to win the championship and trains daily.
I like binge-watching reality shows and not much else.
Laura's consistent blog updates garnered her a book deal with a major publisher.
He spends all day on social media instead of working on his skills.
Ted takes online courses during lunch breaks to improve his coding skills.
We want to travel to every continent before turning 40.
You seem content just going through the motions of daily life.
Mira applied to ten different jobs in one week, determined to switch careers.
Peter sleeps in until noon and shows no interest in finding a job.
I'm always looking for the next challenge to tackle at work.
Sasha attends networking events to connect with industry leaders.
He never goes the extra mile; mediocrity suits him fine.
Claire enrolled in night classes to earn her Master's degree while working full-time.
You could be more if you tried, but you don't seem to care.
Tom aims to read fifty books this year, tracking his progress meticulously.
Jennifer aspires to turn her small pottery hobby into a thriving business.
The company's rapid expansion isn't surprising given its CEO's unwavering ambition.
I could apply for promotions, but I don't really feel the need to.
Luke is working two jobs to save enough money to buy his house.
She enters every science fair and contest she finds.
You show no interest in taking on new projects at work.
Miguel records every bit of his daily life, aiming to become a famous vlogger.
Hannah is always the last to leave the gym, pushing herself to new limits.
They seem satisfied with their current achievement levels.
Sarah is taking guitar lessons, hoping to perform at open mic nights soon.
I feel like he's not motivated to strive for anything more.
Jerome's intense study sessions earned him a full scholarship to a prestigious university.
We are planning to launch our new app to revolutionize the health industry.
You often say you're fine with how things are, never wanting to push for more.
Rachel started a community garden to bring people together and promote organic food.
Tanya refuses to update her skill set, although her field keeps evolving.
I stayed up all night crafting the perfect grant proposal.
You didn't even try to make a good impression in the interview.
Jasmine writes short stories with the hope of getting published someday.
My brother just got promoted to manager, he's always been very driven.
Alice prefers daydreaming about her ideal job but never takes steps to achieve it.
You always accept your first draft without any revisions.
Daniel took extra courses to start a new career path in data science.
We stayed up late workshopping our idea for the startup pitch competition.
